revised_title: Contributions to the Study of Sea-Snake Venoms: Part I. Venoms of Enhydrina valakadien and Enliydris curtus
tldr: This study investigates the action of sea-snake venoms, specifically Enhydrina valakadien and Enliydris curtus, and their effects on various animals. The authors explore the venom's impact on the blood, heart, and motor nerve-ends, as well as the antagonism between Calmette's serum and sea-snake venom. They also discuss the minimum-lethal doses for different animals and the symptoms of sea-snake poisoning.
